A careless admin encrypted the flag using RSA, but mistakenly leaked half the private key bits. Can you recover the message? Ciphertext: 4612130318523193198965620756530888911185539609183180879034906803342008235544792172164754808421085191397603670247220134715374059120525688638477422161996786

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7437364623769472862837880836766993046690799466152075163428438627777229669947290726837493158725843864599389092546813728449928768426436111080005807347959983, e=6171529098755551849300072261632373621036757653977547974920567291067041141985249583924052556780296225277507326303128214771225759337699115731186683263271357, partial_p=17564431403919874697

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{ds2war0f}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4612130318523193198965620756530888911185539609183180879034906803342008235544792172164754808421085191397603670247220134715374059120525688638477422161996786
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7437364623769472862837880836766993046690799466152075163428438627777229669947290726837493158725843864599389092546813728449928768426436111080005807347959983, e=6171529098755551849300072261632373621036757653977547974920567291067041141985249583924052556780296225277507326303128214771225759337699115731186683263271357, partial_p=17564431403919874697
extra_info: p=110253722846625759016880842403565042830662946033207046925322136259015883033473, q=67456811722499476592889410857937194669665200190192901884343343239314382285871, Ï†(n)=7437364623769472862837880836766993046690799466152075163428438627777229669947113016302924033490234094346127590309313400303705368477626445600507477082640640
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
